crawler package

Submodules

crawler.crawler module

crawler.crawler.crawl()[source]

Crawl the Wikipedia websites for the data on the countries and their properties.

Returns

A list with the countries, capitals, population, area, density, neighbouring countries, time zones, constitutional form, official languages, regional languages, minority languages, national languages, and widely spoken languages.

Return type

list

crawler.crawler.get_capitals(countries)[source]

Get a list of capital cities for a given list of countries.

Parameters

countries (list) – A list of strings representing the names of the countries.

Returns

A dictionary mapping each country to a list of its capital cities.

Return type

dict

crawler.crawler.get_demographics_info(column, countries)[source]

Get demographic information for a list of countries from Wikipedia.

Parameters

  • column (int or str) – The column number or name for the desired information on the Wikipedia page.

  • countries (list) – A list of strings representing the names of the countries.

Returns

A dictionary mapping each country to its demographic information as an integer.

Return type

dict

crawler.crawler.get_languages(column, countries)[source]

Get a list of languages by given column for each country in the given list.

Parameters

  • column (int) – The column number for the language information on the Wikipedia page.

  • countries (list) – A list of strings representing the names of countries.

Returns

A dictionary mapping country names to lists of official languages.

Return type

dict

crawler.crawler.get_multiple_info(url, countries, column)[source]

Get specific information for each country in the given list from the given Wikipedia page.

Parameters

  • url (str) – The URL of the Wikipedia page to scrape.

  • countries (list) – A list of strings representing the names of countries.

  • column (int or str) – The column number or name for the desired information on the Wikipedia page.

Returns

A dictionary mapping country names to the desired information.

Return type

dict

crawler.crawler.get_other_capitals(capitals, tr, td, countries)[source]

Get a list of capital cities for a given list of countries.

Parameters

  • capitals (list) – A list of capital cities for a given country.

  • tr (BeautifulSoup) – A BeautifulSoup object representing a table row.

  • td (BeautifulSoup) – A BeautifulSoup object representing a table cell.

  • countries (list) – A list of strings representing the names of the countries.

Returns

A list of capital cities for a given country.

Return type

list

crawler.crawler.init_countries()[source]

Initialize a list of countries by scraping Wikipedia.

Returns

A list of strings representing the names of countries.

Return type

list

crawler.helpers module

crawler.helpers.anchors_are_valid(anchors)[source]

Check if the given anchors are valid.

This function checks if the given anchors are not empty and contain a title. It returns a boolean indicating whether the anchors are valid or not.

Parameters

anchors (list of dict) – The anchors to be checked.

Returns

A boolean indicating whether the anchors are valid or not.

Return type

bool

crawler.helpers.clean_language(language)[source]

Clean the given language string by removing unnecessary characters and words.

Parameters

language (str) – The language string to be cleaned.

Returns

The cleaned language string.

Return type

str

crawler.helpers.clean_title(title)[source]

Clean the given title by removing unnecessary prefixes.

This function removes unnecessary prefixes from the given title, such as “Demographics of the” or “Population of”, in order to obtain the name of the country.

Parameters

title (str) – The title to be cleaned.

Returns

The cleaned version of the title.

Return type

str

crawler.helpers.format_languages(languages)[source]

Format the given list of languages by cleaning and normalizing them.

This function removes unnecessary prefixes and suffixes from the languages in the list, and splits multiple languages that are separated by commas. It also removes empty or invalid languages.

Parameters

languages (list of str) – The list of languages to be formatted.

Returns

The formatted list of languages.

Return type

list of str

crawler.helpers.get_column_number(column)[source]

Get the number of the column corresponding to the given property.

This function maps the given property to a specific column number in a table. The column number is used to retrieve the data for the given property.

Parameters

column (str) – The property for which the column number is to be retrieved.

Returns

The column number for the given property.

Return type

int

crawler.helpers.get_languages_from_td(td, country, countries)[source]

Get the languages from the given td element.

This function retrieves the languages from the given td element and adds them to the list of languages for the given country.

Parameters

  • td (bs4.element.Tag) – The td element from which the languages are to be retrieved.

  • country (str) – The name of the country for which the languages are to be retrieved.

  • countries (dict of str to list of str) – The dictionary of countries and their languages.

Returns

The list of languages for the given country.

Return type

list of str

crawler.helpers.normalize_country_name(country)[source]

Normalize the given country name.

Some country names may be ambiguous or not match the official name of the country. This function returns the official name of the country for the given input.

Parameters

country (str) – The name of the country to be normalized.

Returns

The normalized country name.

Return type

str
